page.title: 04A FARMERS TYPICAL DAY
page.content: The farmer has been around for thousands of years,but his machinery is now more developed.From the donkey to the oxen to the tractor.Fields which used to take a day to plough,now only take an hour.There are 3 farms in the village of Milnthorpe,Cumbria.The farmers who own them are my uncle Mr.Garnett,Mr.Whitfield and Mr.Melling.They all get up at 5 or 6a.m.and do the milking.This is done by attaching metal tubes to the cows udders,and switching on the machine and the machine extracts the milk from the cow.Then a milk tanker collects the Milk Marketing Board.After the milking has been done,the farmer might go for his breakfast.then he would probably do any jobs that needed to be done e.g.fencing,walling,sillaging or haytime if it was in the summer time. If the farmers want to buy or sell
